thread.title: Arsenal news: Kieran Gibbs reveals why Mark Clattenburg didn't send him off vs Hull City | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Kieran Gibbs reveals why Mark Clattenburg didn't send him off vs Hull City | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Kieran Gibbs reveals why Mark Clattenburg didn't send him off vs Hull City | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 3:27 pm Kieran Gibbs was lucky to escape a red against Hull City. (Getty Images) 
Kieran Gibbs has claimed that Mark Clattenburg did not send him off for his last-man challenge on Lazar Markovic because the ball was going away from goal. 
The Arsenal left-back was lucky to escape a red card in the second half after he barged the Hull City winger off the ball when he was clean through on goal. 
But Gibbs has revealed Clattenburg’s reasoning for only giving a yellow card for the foul. 
‘I took a chance because Lauri [Laurent Koscielny] and Musti [Shkodran Mustafi] both jumped for the ball, I did actually try to go for the ball,’ Gibbs told Sky Sports. Clattenburg allegedly said the ball was going away from goal. (Getty Images) 
‘Mark’s view was that was the ball was going away from goal. 
‘He said the ball was going away from goal, there’s not much I can say.’
